So there were a lot of factories in Treforist that were set up by refugees?
In
1939 and beginning
1940 there was hardly any English spoken on the Treforist estate.
The language spoken was either Czech or German or Hungarian and
slowly slowly people learned English and
We
Spoke English more and more so
the things were improving and
At the top of the of the war there must have been easily
15,000 people working on the estate
